A number of vultures assembled together.
The path left behind a ship on the surface of the water.
The turbulent air left behind a flying aircraft.
The area behind something, typically a rapidly moving object.
Something twisted, intertwined, or curled.
usageExamples: a wreath of smoke;  a wreath of clouds

senses.definition: An ornamental circular band made, for example, of plaited flowers and leaves, and used as decoration; a garland or chaplet, especially one given to a victor.

An appendage to the shield, placed above it, and supporting the crest; an orle, a torse. It generally represents a twist of two cords of silk, one tinctured like the principal metal, the other like the principal color in the coat of arms.
A defect in glass.
To place an entwined circle of flowers upon or around something.
To wrap around something in a circle.
usageExamples: At the funeral, a circle of comrades wreathed the grave of the honored deceased.

senses.definition: To curl, writhe or spiral in the form of a wreath.
